results.description:
DOMINEERING SCREECH:
The Archdeacon emits an ear-piercing keening that shakes anyone present to their very core. Anyone within MEDIUM range must make an immediate Panic Roll.

SKULL SLAM:
The Archdeacon slams its skull into the victim's head. The victim is attacked using [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 2. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts critical injury #31 (even if the victim is not Broken), triggering an immediate Panic Roll.

CLAW RAKE:
The Archdeacon slashes its victim with its razor-sharp claws. The victim is attacked using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

LATCH JAW:
The Archdeacon's jaws spring forward and clamp down on a victim's arm or leg. The victim is attacked using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 2. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts critical injury #36 or #41 accordingly (even if the victim is not Broken). Anything the victim is holding is dropped. Any CLOSE COMBAT attempt to break the grapple suffers a -3 modification. The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll. The Archdeacon will attack a grappled victim using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 2 (this attack cannot be blocked) instead of rolling for another random attack.

SPINAL SNAP:
The Archdeacon's jaws latch onto a victim's neck, grabbing it. The victim is attacked using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 2. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts critical injury #56 (even if the victim is not Broken). The victim is paralyzed from the neck down. Anything the victim is holding is dropped. The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll. The Archdeacon immediately drags the victim to a neighboring zone.

RESTRAIN:
The automaton restrains the target using its hydraulic grip-vices, making a grapple attack with [[8db]] Base Dice.

The target gains a +2 modification if they attempt to dodge using MOBILITY, but if the attack hits the target is grappled and will be taken to Godafoss falls or another safe location.

INTIMIDATE:
The automaton produces a low growl and takes a step forward.

It says:
“For your safety, obey my instructions—you have five seconds to comply.”

The target gains +1 STRESS LEVEL and all future automaton attack rolls for this robot gain +1 to the roll.

KNOCK:
The automaton sweeps its huge arms at the target and attacks with [[8db]] Base Dice.

If the target is hit, they only take one point of damage, are knocked prone and must make a STAMINA roll or be stunned, losing their next slow action.

BATTER:
Positronic potentials in the automaton's brain build to a crescendo as it becomes desperate to stop the target.

It attempts to batter them into submission, making a [[10db]] Base Dice attack, Damage 1.

CRUSH:
The automaton seeks to immobilize the target as swiftly as possible, deeming it a safety threat.
It grabs with the grip-vice and crushes without mercy, with a [[10db]] Base Dice attack, Damage 1.

If the target takes any damage they have been crushed in half, and are killed.

All who witness this gain +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make a Panic Roll.

SEARING FLAME:
In an attempt to frighten the target using its cutting torch the automaton actually makes an attack, with [[5db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

BOLT VOLLEY:
The automaton's built-in bolt gun clicks over and fires three bolts in quick succession, each attack has [[3db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.

BLINDING MAGNIFICENCE:
The lithe and graceful Biomorph radiates an eerie glow that fills the room, gently pulsing in rhythm with its victim's heartbeat. Everyone in its glorious presence gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.
The targeted victim must make a successful STAMINA roll.
Failure means they are blinded.

OBSERVATION and RANGED COMBAT are at -2 until a MEDICAL AID roll is made.

DECOMPRESS:
The Xenomorph releases all liquid within its muscles.
Treat the resulting spray as an Acid Splash 8, directed at the nearest victim only. The decompressed Biomorph squeezes through the nearest crack or grating if possible, flowing two zones away in one action.
As soon as the PCs lose line of sight to the Biomorph's radiant glow, it has escaped. Stealth mode ensues.

BURNING TOUCH:
The Biomorph puts its phosphoric hands forward, reaching out towards its victim as if to cease hostilities.
If successful, the Biomorph lays its hands on its victim, immediately causing severe radiation burns.
The attack is made with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If hit, the victim continues to burn at Intensity 8. The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll.

SCREW TOP:
The beast's clawed hand whips out and grabs its target by the neck.
It attacks with [[7db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. It then drapes the fingers of its other hand over the victim's head.
If the victim doesn't break free, the next Round the Xenomorph automatically begins to twist—attempting to pop the target's head off like the lid of a jar.
If successful, the victim automatically suffers critical injury #56. If the Xenomorph isn't stopped before the next Round, the victim is decapitated.

ACID REFLUX:
The Xenomorph opens its outer jaws wide, seemingly ready to deliver a headbite. Instead, it spews acid in its victim's face. The attack is rolled with [[10db]] Base Dice.
If successful, treat it as an Acid Splash 8 directed at the target only.

VAMPIRE SPIKE:
The Biomorph opens its outer jaws wide, and its inner spiked proboscis shoots forward like a piston. The attack is rolled with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.
If it causes any damage, the Biomorph begins draining the fluids from its victim one point of Health at a time. the victim cannot break free, they are automatically drained another point the next Round.

INTIMIDATE:
The Trilo­bite rises to its full three-meter height, exposing its underbelly maw and sizing up its victim. Panic Roll.

SIZING UP FOR HOSTS:
The beast silently undulates and shakes its tentacles as it surveys the available targets. It seems to be smelling or tasting the air in its search for the best host. Everyone within SHORT range gains +1 STRESS and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

GRABBING TENTACLE:
The Trilo­bite whips out a tentacle, snaring the victim. It attacks with eight Base Dice [[8db]], Damage 1. If the tentacle hits, the Trilo­bite immediately drags the victim to a neighboring zone. The victim goes prone. STRESS LEVEL increases by +1 for the victim and they must make an immediate Panic Roll.

TOPPLING LASH:
The Trilo­bite lashes out with a tentacle, sweeping the victim’s legs. It attacks with ten Base Dice [[10db]], Damage 1. If the attack hits, the victim is knocked prone, dropping any hand-held items. The victim gains STRESS LEVEL +1 and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

CRUSHING GRAPPLE:
The Trilo­bite wraps its tentacles around the victim, grabbing it. It attacks with eight Base Dice [[8db]], Damage 2. If it hits it automatically inflicts critical injury #33 (even if the victim is not Broken) and the victim makes an immediate Panic Roll.

VIOLATION:
The Trilo­bite entangles the victim with its tentacles, grabbing it. Make an opposed roll with ten Base Dice [[10db]] against the target’s CLOSE COMBAT skill.
  • If the Trilo­bite wins, the victim is grappled, and tendrils force their head into position. Immediately roll for a new attack with ten Base Dice [[10db]]. If it gets one or more
       , the poor victim is immediately Broken and suffers critical injury #46. Their last sensations are horrifying as the Trilo­bite thrusts its proboscis into the victim’s mouth, implanting its embryo before they pass out. The Trilo­bite goes catatonic, covering the victim with its own body to protect the host during embryo implantation.
  • If the victim wins, they fend off the proboscis for this attack, but they must still make an immediate Panic Roll.

ASSEMBLE THE LEGIONS:
The massive Xenomorph hisses, calling [[1d6]] Soldiers and two Praetorians to her defense.
They reach the zone the following Round, then draw initiative and can act.
Unless in danger, the Empress will have her legions herd anyone present to the egg chamber for impregnation.

PSYCHIC LOVE:
The Empress reaches into her victim's mind, stimulating primal memories of gestating within their mother's womb and manipulating them to walk over to the nearest egg and submit themselves to a Facehugger.

The mental attack uses [[7db]] Base Dice, rolled as an opposed roll against the victim's Empathy.
If the victim manages to shake the Empress' control, they cannot be manipulated by her again—but they will always feel her whispering in their head.
The victim gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

CRUSHING BLOW:
The Empress brings her entire weight down on the poor victim, who must make a MOBILITY roll at -2 (no action) or be crushed, immediately suffering three critical injuries (roll three times on the critical injury table and apply all three results, regardless of whether or not the victim is Broken).

The victim is knocked prone and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

PSYCHIC BOLT:
The Empress attacks her victim with a crippling mind strike.
The attack is made with [[14db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.
If any damage is done, the victim automatically suffers critical injuries #15 and #16. The victim gains +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

TAIL SLICE:
The tail slices through the victim with terrible force.
Roll for the attack using [[14db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. The attack is armor piercing.

If the attack causes any damage, it automatically triggers critical injury #63, slicing the victim in half and killing them outright.

MIND MELT:
The Empress opens her mouth wide as she brings the full power of her mind against her victim.
The attack uses [[14db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

If it causes any damage, the victim's Wits and Empathy are each reduced one step. If the Empress is not distracted, the victim will lose another point each Round until they reach zero, wiping the victim's mind and making them a vegetable.

POWER HUNGRY:
The Octobug makes an attack with [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 1, ignores armor.
If it hits, it sucks [[1d3]] power from the Power Supply of a random item in the target's possession.
If the item is a compression suit, respirator or other breathing kit the power dips and the item loses [[1d3]] from its Air Supply instead.

SUFFOCATING:
The creatures cover, fill or otherwise block the airways of their target.
Attack with [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If any damage is inflicted the victim is grappled and suffers suffocation.

NECROTIZING VENOM:
The Octobug attacks with [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.
If the target suffers any damage, they are bitten, jabbed, spiked or scratched with venom that starts to eat them from within, Virulence 8.
They must make a save every Turn or suffer one point of Damage until they resist, get MEDICAL help, or die.

GO FOR THE HOT SPOT:
The Octobug targets the biggest source of power within SHORT range (this could be a compression suit worn by a PC, or a vehicle), and makes an attack with [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.
If the attack hits the target suffers a huge power surge, sparks fly, systems fry, and the equipment shorts out completely (if the target is a vehicle, roll on the Component Damage Table).

SWARMING CRITTERS:
The Octobugs swarm and go for the kill, tearing, slicing and ripping at their target.
The victim takes an attack with [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.
Any damage mitigated by armor causes an extra point of damage to the armor and may cause a sealed suit to tear.

GOO GURGLE:
The Shambler throws its head back and gargles frothing black goo in its throat. The horrid bleating sounds like a drowning goat. All PCs within SHORT range gain +1 STRESS.

SHAMBLE:
The Shambler slowly shuffles forward, taking its time as it savors its victim's fear. If possible, the Shambler will corner the victim and stare them down. The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll.

CHOMP:
The Shambler's snapping jaws try to take a chunk out of its victim. Roll for the attack using [[edb]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes damage, it automatically triggers critical injury #34 (even if the victim is not Broken), triggering an immediate Panic Roll.

BLACK GOOGIE:
The Shambler rears its head back and lunges forward, hurling a lump of black goo at the victim's eyes. The attack is made with [[8db]] Base Dice. A hit means the victim suffers the effects of critical injury #15 and must make a Sickness Roll against Virulence 6.
Failure means they become a Stage I Abomination.

GRAB AND REND:
The Shambler attempts to grab hold of the victim, pinning them.
Roll for the attack using [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. A successful hit means the victim is grappled.
The Shambler has latched onto their arm or leg (GM's discretion) and lifted them off the ground, triggering an immediate Panic Roll.
If any damage is done, the Shambler crushes the secured limb, causing critical injury #36 or #41 accordingly.

The creature holds on to its victim until the next Round, where it rolls to grab one of the victim's other limbs as well.
If successful, the Shambler tries to rend them apart like a wishbone.
Roll for the attack using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts either critical injury #54 or #55 and the victim is considered Broken.

DISTENDED JAWS:
The Shambler raises itself high on its high legs, unhinges its jaw and comes down hard on the victim in an attempt to swallow them. The attack is made with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.
A successful hit means the victim's head and shoulders are engulfed in the Shambler's throat. Everyone present must make a Panic Roll.
The next Round the Shambler automatically inflicts another point of damage and gets the victim in up to their waist. At this point, the victim cannot free themselves and must be saved by another. They can, however, still make CLOSE COMBAT attacks at -3 for all rolls. If not freed by the third Round, the victim is completely swallowed.
While swallowing a victim, the Shambler will take no other actions. Anyone attacked in this manner must make a Sickness roll vs Virulence 6 for every Round they are inside the creature's mouth. Failure means they become a Stage I Abomination.

CHITTER AND RUSH:
Choosing its target, the Xenoixodida chitters to its brethren and rushes its victim. Everyone in the zone must make an immediate Panic Roll. The victim must make a MOBILITY roll. If it fails, the Xenoixodida leaps upon them, knocking the victim prone. Unless the creature is removed, it will automatically perform a Pop attack on their next initiative.

SWARM:
The Xenoixodidas attack as one, crawling all over all victims within a zone. It is almost impossible to breathe. Everyone inside the Swarm area must make a STAMINA roll. Failure means the victim cannot act during the next Round, and the Xenoixodida will perform a Pounce and Jab attack against the victim as its next action.

POUNCE AND JAB:
Two forelegs raised, the creature leaps at the victim, driving them through their flesh like bony-hooks. The attack is with [[5db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

POP:
Over-excited, the Xenoixodida, well, pops. The attack is rolled with [[5db]] Base Dice. If successful, treat as an Acid Splash 6 to anyone in the immediate vicinity.

SNARL:
The Venator utters a low guttural snarl, announcing its intentions to strike. Everyone present must make an immediate Panic Roll.

STALK:
With its active camouflage in play, the Venator enters stealth mode, stalking its victim, looking for a vulnerability to exploit. Everyone who sees it fade into the background gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

LUNGE:
The Venator leaps at the victim.
Roll for the attack using [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack is successful, the victim is thrown to the ground and must make an immediate Panic Roll, and the Venator immediately performs an extra attack with [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 2 (does not count as an action). The extra attack cannot be blocked.

RECOIL:
The Venator doesn't like the odds and decides to regroup. The creature activates its camouflage and fades away, retreating to a safe distance to stalk the victim from afar.

SLICING ARMS:
The Venator strikes its victim with its sickle-armed limbs, triggering an immediate Panic Roll. Roll for the attack with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes damage, the victim automatically suffers critical injury #25 or #46.

MAUL:
The Venator pounces on its victim using eight Base Dice to attack. If successful, the victim is considered grappled as the Venator's hooked claws and spike-toothed maw shreds and tears at the victim's face and torso. Roll the attack with [[8db]] Base Dice. If any damage is done, roll for the following critical injuries.
1-2: #21, 3-4: #45, 5-6: #61.

SLITHERING ESCAPE:
In a blur of whipping tentacles, the Squid-Baby flees one zone away, slipping into the nearest cover or air duct if possible. As soon as the PCs lose line of sight, combat ends and stealth mode ensues. After one Shift, the Squid-Baby grows into a Trilo­bite and begins looking for a host to implant.

REVULSION:
The Squid-Baby’s undulating motions are revolting to watch, inducing waves of nausea in everyone within close range. Victims must make a Sickness Roll against Virulence 8 or immediately drop what they are carrying, losing a round of action.

VICE-LIKE GRAPPLE:
The Squid-Baby hurls itself at the victim and latches on with its tiny but strong tentacles. Roll using six Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 2. If any damage is caused, the victim is grappled, automatically inflicting critical injury #13 (even if the victim is not Broken) and triggering an immediate Panic Roll.

SMOTHER ATTACK:
The Squid-Baby snaps its tentacles onto the victim’s head and squeezes with an unexpected crushing power. The attack has a strength of six Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 1. Any damage sustained automatically inflicts critical injury #16, but the Squid-Baby remains attached. The victim will suffocate unless the Squid-Baby’s grip can be broken (see Suffocation on page 110 of the core rulebook).

Hypnotizing Gaze: The Xenomorph, eyeless as it may seem, stares deeply into the soul of its victim. The victim is mesmerized by the dread beauty of such a beast. They stand in awe of what nature, or god, or the devil has created, get +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

Playing With Its Prey The Xeno attacks, but not to kill. The target is knocked to the ground and drops all hand-held items, but otherwise takes no damage. The Xenomorph stands over them, taunting its prey to run so the game can go on. The victim gets +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

Deadly Grab: The beast launches through the air, grabbing its victim. It attacks with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If it hits it immediately drags them into a neighboring zone, dumping them on the floor. The victim is prone, drops all hand-held items and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

Ready to Kill: The Xenomorph grabs its victim, its inner jaws poised to strike. Roll for the attack with [[10db]] Base Dice. If it hits, the victim counts as grabbed (see page 93) and needs to make an opposed CLOSE COMBAT roll against ten Base Dice to break loose. The victim and all friendly characters in the same zone must make Panic Rolls. Unless the victim breaks free, the Xenomorph will use a HEADBITE attack against them on its next initiative.

HEADBITE: The Xenomorph opens its outer jaws wide, and the deadly inner jaws lean out, gnashing in anticipation before snapping forwards. The attack has a strength of [[9db]] Base Dice, Damage 2. If it causes any damage it automatically inflicts critical injury #64, killing the victim in one dreadful blow. However, should the GM wish it, the victim remains just alive enough for the Xenomorph to initiate the ovomorphing process.

Capture for the Hive: The Xenomorph attacks with its venom-spiked tail, with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes any damage, the Xeno pulls its punch so only one point of damage is inflicted, and the paralyzing venom takes effect. The victim must make a STAMINA roll—the number of Success's rolled is the number of Rounds they can stay up, then they fall unconscious for one Shift. The paralysis can be removed with a shot of adrenaline (a MEDICAL AID roll using a Medkit).

Headbite: The Xenomorph opens its outer jaws wide, and the deadly inner jaws lean out, gnashing in anticipation before snapping forwards. The attack has a strength of [[9db]] Base Dice, Damage 2. If it causes any damage it automatically inflicts critical injury #64, killing the victim in one dreadful blow. However, should the GM wish it, the victim remains just alive enough for the Xenomorph to initiate the ovomorphing process.

MESMERIZE:
The Perfected stares down its victim in SHORT range with its pitch-black eyes. The victim must make a Wits roll (the attribute only, no skill) or be lost in the depths of those soulless voids, entranced and immobilized. If the roll fails, the victim loses their next fast and slow action. In addition, STRESS LEVEL increases by +1 for the victim and all friendly PCs in SHORT range. If uninterrupted, the Perfected will attempt a Fatal Kiss attack on its next action.

FATAL KISS:
Make an opposed roll with ten Base Dice [[10db]] against the target’s CLOSE COMBAT skill (does not count as an action for the victim).
  • If the Perfected is successful, it embraces the victim, leaning in for a kiss. Immediately roll for another attack with ten Base Dice [[10db]] (does not count as an action).
    One or more   means the Perfected locks lips with the victim, lashing its barbed tongue into their mouth.

    The victim is immediately Broken by this and automatically suffers critical injury #46.
    If the victim wins, they fend off the kiss, but must still make an immediate Panic Roll.

TURN:
The Perfected locks eyes with the nearest victim. Through a combination of mental prowess and pheromones, it can hypnotize a single victim into attacking their own kind. The victim must succeed at a straight Empathy test (no skill) or be compelled to defend the Fulfremmen who hypnotized them. The hypnotism lasts until the victim succeeds at an Empathy test, made at the start of each Round, or suffers damage, which breaks the link.

PSIONIC BLAST:
This mental surge reverberates through the victim’s skull, automatically causing critical injury #16 and ears, eyes and nose to bleed. The attack is made with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

SLASH AND GRAB:
Using Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 1, the Perfected attempts to rake its nails across its victim’s torso. Unless the victim is able to contain the bleeding, the Perfected will be able to track the victim through the scent of their blood.

PSIONIC SUMMONING:
A psionic whistling rings in the ears of everyone present, calling two Deacons to the Perfected’s defense. They reach the zone the following Round, then draw initiative and can act.

FATAL KISS:
Make an opposed roll with ten Base Dice [[10db]] against the target’s CLOSE COMBAT skill (does not count as an action for the victim).
  • If the Perfected is successful, it embraces the victim, leaning in for a kiss. Immediately roll for another attack with ten Base Dice [[10db]] (does not count as an action).
    One or more   means the Perfected locks lips with the victim, lashing its barbed tongue into their mouth.

    The victim is immediately Broken by this and automatically suffers critical injury #46.
    If the victim wins, they fend off the kiss, but must still make an immediate Panic Roll.

BOLT:
The Hammerpede slithers off with incredible speed, reaching two zones away within a single Round. Everyone present gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

MESMERIZING DANCE:
The Hammerpede raises its head, swaying back and forth to captivate its victim. The victim must make a Wits roll (the attribute only, no skill) to resist. If the roll fails, the victim loses their next fast and slow action.

INTIMIDATE:
The Hammerpede unfurls its hoods, displaying its mouth with a hiss. All present gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.

GRASP:
The Hammerpede latches onto the victim with a vice-like grip, attempting to pull them to it. The attack is made with [[10db]] Base Dice. If successful, the victim is considered grappled. If they cannot break free on the next Round, the Hammerpede will automatically make a Squeeze and Snap attack.

SQUEEZE AND SNAP:
Using ten Base Dice, the Hammerpede wraps itself around one of its victims' extremities (arm or leg) and squeezes.  Victim must make an immediate Panic Roll.  If any damage is done, the victim immediately suffers critical injury #36 or #41 respectively, as the Hammerpede snaps the limb in half.  Whatever protective suit the victim is wearing is ripped, exposing them to the elements and giving the Hammerpede a way in.

PUNCH AND DEEP THROAT:
The coiled up Hammerpede strikes with its balled-up head, punching the victim repeatedly. 
The attack is with [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.  If any damage is done, the Hammerpede will immediately attempt to ram itself down the victim's throat. 
 The attack uses [[6db]] Base Dice.  If any damage is done, the Hammerpede lodges itself in the victim's esophagus and begins to suffocate them.  The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll and suffers the effects of drowning until the victim, or their friends can make an opposed strength roll against [[6db]] Base Dice to pull the Hammerpede out of the victim's throat.

HERDING:
The Xenomorph spreads its limbs, bares its teeth and shepherds the victim.
The victim must win an opposed MOBILITY roll against [[10db]] Base Dice or be forced to move wherever the Xenomorph wants—near a Facehugger, into the arms of another Drone or Scout, or somewhere else where capturing the PC is made easier.

Make an immediate Panic Roll.

NO ESCAPE:
The Xenomorph pauses and hisses at its victim, before scampering away to an adjacent zone.
But the Xenomorph is only biding its time—when it acts on the next Round, it has been joined by another of the same type, and they both attack the original target.

BRING THEM DOWN:
The Xenomorph sweeps with arms, legs and tail, lashing out to bring the victim to the ground.
It attacks with [[10db]] Base Dice against the target's CLOSE COMBAT.

If successful, the target is battered to the ground, drops any handheld items, suffers one point of damage and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

FACE GRAB:
The Xenomorph grasps the victim's face, an opposed grappling attack with [[8db]] Base Dice.

If the Xenomorph succeeds, it does no damage, but the victim is grappled, blinded, and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

If the victim does not break the grapple, the Xenomorph's next attack is automatically #6.

CAPTURE FOR THE HIVE:
The Xenomorph attacks with its venom-spiked tail, with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.

If the attack causes any damage, the Xenomorph pulls its punch so only one point of damage is inflicted, and the paralyzing venom takes effect.

The victim must make a STAMINA roll—the number of rolled is the number of Rounds they can stay up, then they fall unconscious for [[1d6]] Turns.

The paralysis can be removed with a shot of adrenaline (a MEDICAL AID roll with a medkit).

STUN THE HOST:
The Xenomorph attacks the victim with [[9db]] Base Dice, Damage 1, its inner jaw flashing out.

But it's not trying to kill.

If the attack does any damage, the victim is immediately Broken and knocked unconscious by the blow.
They do not suffer any critical effect even though they are Broken, but are unconscious for [[1d6]] Turns.
Single
Binary (roll two stars, roll for which one the planet orbits)
Trinary (roll three stars, roll for which one the planet orbits)

name: 02 - Star Type
description: White and blue stars are the hottest, with red the coolest. For reference, Sol is a G Class Main Sequence star, with a radius of 700,000 km and surface temperature of 6,000 ˚C, and one AU (astronomical unit—the average distance between Earth and Sol) is 150 million km.

results.description: Supergiant—white, yellow or red, radius 0.5 AU+
Giant—blue, white, yellow or red,  radius up to 0.25 AU
Subgiant—blue, white, yellow or red,  radius up to 0.1 AU
G Class Main Sequence—white, yellow or orange, radius up to 1.5 million km
Red Dwarf—orange or red,  radius 100,000–500,000 km
White Dwarf—white or blue,  radius less than 5,000 km
Inner moon of a gas giant (−4 on the Planet Size, –1 on Climate, +2 on Radiation roll)
Outer moon of a gas giant (−2 on Planet Size, −2 on Climate, +1 on Radiation roll)
1st Planet (+3 on Climate roll, +2 on Radiation roll)
2nd Planet (+1 on Climate roll)
3rd Planet
4th Planet (−1 on Climate roll, −1 on Radiation roll)
5th Planet (−3 on Climate roll, −2 on Radiation roll)
Less than 1,000 km (Atmosphere result is automatically None—gravity 0.2G or less)
2,000 km (–4 on Atmosphere Roll—0.3G)
4,000 km (–3 on Atmosphere Roll—0.5G)
7,000 km (–2 on Atmosphere Roll—0.7G)
None (−4 on Climate roll, −4 on Hydrosphere roll)
Thin (−2 on Climate roll, −2 on Hydrosphere roll)
Breathable
Dense (+1 on Climate roll)
Toxic
Corrosive (+4 on Climate roll)
Special
None
Weak
Strong
Extreme
Frozen (−50 °C or less)
Cold (−50 to 0 °C, +1 on Hydrosphere roll)
Temperate (0 to 30 °C, +1 on Hydrosphere roll)
Hot (31 to 60 °C, −2 on Hydrosphere roll)
Burning (61 °C or more, −4 on Hydrosphere roll)
Desert (no water)
Arid (only trace water, underground or permafrost)
Temperate Dry (oceans cover up to 30%, can be frozen)
Temperate Wet (oceans cover 60–70%, can be frozen)
Wet world (global ocean with some islands, can be frozen)
Water world (no dry land, can be frozen)
Short day, [[1d6]] hours
Earth-like day, [[3d6*2]] hours
Long rotational period, [[2d6*2d6]] hours
Extreme rotation period, [[1d666]] hours
Abandoned station or satellites, or extra­terrestrial artifacts
Tidally locked
Abundant and complex biodiversity
Scattered simple lifeforms (e.g. microbes, primitive plants)
Dust-laden, permanent sunset sky
World-spanning super canyon
Multiple small and fast-orbiting moons
[[1d3]] large moons and/or a ring system
Long elliptical orbit, bringing severe seasons
Huge moon dominates the sky, bringing huge tides
Roll twice
None
Up to 25°—mild seasons
25–50°—severe seasons
50–75°—devastating seasonal effects

TERRAIN
Extensive deserts

RESOURCE POTENTIAL MODIFIER
−2

RESOURCE POTENTIAL
Abysmal: −2

POSSIBLE EXAMPLES
There is nothing but useless muck here, the weather or environment makes operations impossible, and nothing can grow on land or in water.

Resources are rare and low quality. Operations can be managed but will be tough and expensive.

Average: ±0

The region seems reasonable and may well be worth exploring.

EVENT
Everything has gone so smoothly this world-building job seems easy.

OUTCOME
+1 to all attribute scores

EVENT
The weather has been kind, and everyone has been enjoying the opportunities this brings.

OUTCOME
Maintenance +2,
Science +1,
Potential +1

EVENT
Baby boom, the colonists are happy, and it shows.

OUTCOME
Spirit +2,
Productivity +1,
Economy +1

EVENT
A small earthquake has uncovered previously unknown resources.

OUTCOME
Science +2,
Potential +2

EVENT
A corporate executive sails into town to inspect progress. It keeps the corporates busy and brings a buzz to the place.

OUTCOME
Economy +1,
Spirit +1,
Productivity +1

EVENT
A new power-saving initiative has seen reserves flourish. The colony’s systems are working as well as anyone can remember.

OUTCOME
Maintenance +2,
Productivity +1

EVENT
Some disruptive elements had started to cause trouble, but the Marshal quickly put these troublemakers in their place

OUTCOME
Spirit +1,
Economy +1

EVENT
New working practices have made the factories more efficient and the workers happier.

OUTCOME
Productivity +1,
Spirit +1

EVENT
Some new lab technicians arrived on the last inbound colony ship and have taken to working here as if they were born to it.

OUTCOME
Science +1

EVENT
A chance finding by a lone wildcatter has spotted something valuable to exploit and exploit it we will!

OUTCOME
Potential +1

EVENT
The maintenance crews have been working like a dream and the base is spick and span and running with ease.

OUTCOME
Maintenance +1

EVENT
Unexpected supply run—the Company has obviously either made an accounting error or is being unusually generous.

OUTCOME
Economy +1

EVENT
All is quiet and the colony keeps rolling from one day of work to the next.

OUTCOME
Nothing

EVENT
Recent surveys have been coming up with nothing. People are starting to talk, saying maybe this wasn’t the right place to settle after all…

OUTCOME
Potential −1

EVENT
Someone hasn’t been doing their job properly, and a lot of data has been lost.

OUTCOME
Science −1

EVENT
There’s tension in the air and good people are reluctant to venture out after the shift hours are done.

OUTCOME
Spirit −1

EVENT
A corporate exec flew in and created hell about the state of the colony. The focus on nit-picking tasks has put the maintenance crews behind.

OUTCOME
Maintenance −1

EVENT
Something has gone badly wrong in accounting. It might just be an error, but maybe the Company is skimming the profits, or something more criminal.

OUTCOME
Economy −2

EVENT
A dispute has boiled over and the workers have put down tools. Relations have soured and people don’t think the Union Steward handled it well.

OUTCOME
Productivity −1,
Spirit −1

EVENT
Inconceivably, one of the satellites has been lost, burning up in the atmosphere. Fingers are pointed at the Prospector General…

OUTCOME
Potential −2,
Science −1

EVENT
Tensions have been boiling over and the Marshal hasn’t been able or willing to contain it. There’s been violence on the streets and brawling in the bars.

OUTCOME
Spirit −1,
Potential −1,
Productivity −1

EVENT
A disease ravages the colony, taking a terrible toll before it’s brought under control.

OUTCOME
Spirit −2,
Science +1,
Productivity −2,
Maintenance −1.
One of the NPC command team falls ill.

EVENT
A failure somewhere has led to a lack of key supplies and spares for the colony. Systems have broken down and people can’t do their jobs.

OUTCOME
Maintenance −2,
Productivity −1,
Economy −1

EVENT
Terrible weather has battered the colony.

OUTCOME
Spirit −1,
Science −1,
Economy −1,
Maintenance −1

EVENT
Terrible accident at the Colony.

OUTCOME
An NPC in the command team is killed, all current attribute scores are reduced by 1.
A cryosleep room with [[1d66]] beds lined up vertically around the walls, all empty.
A wide chamber with an obsidian plinth in the middle, watched over by four carved heads.

If the PCs are exploring the Lychgate, this is an empty chamber.

If they are fleeing the Xenomorphs after the confrontation at the Core, it is a Xenomorph hive chamber with .
.
[[1d6]] Facehuggers, ..

[[1d6]] Ovomorphs, and ..

[[1d6]] hosts.

If the PCs linger a Drone will appear, at your discretion.
A room with small pools of crystal-clear water, and drapes hanging throughout.  The PCs have to push through them to progress.

The centerpiece of the chamber is a three-meter-wide shaft, dripping water and full of dusty mist.

Roll [[1d6]].

On 1-3, it's on the ceiling and goes upwards,
on 4-6, it's on the floor and goes down.
A shrine of some sort with images and glyphs lining the walls, but too eroded to make any sense of.

name: COLONY SITUATION
description: Roll once per column or choose.

results.description:
SURVIVORS:
None.

SOCIETY:
None, it's anarchy—any survivors scrabble like vermin to survive.

PROBLEM:
The planet is a desolate wasteland.

FEATURE:
A beacon faintly beeping.

RESOURCES:
Abysmal, this place has nothing going for it.

SURVIVORS:
None.

SOCIETY:
It's total anarchy.

PROBLEM:
The planet is a desolate wasteland.

FEATURE:
Underground survival shelters, open and abandoned.

RESOURCES:
Poor, archaeological interest only.

SURVIVORS:
None.

SOCIETY:
Cultural collapse. Survivors speak a dialect the PCs don't understand.

PROBLEM:
A shift in the environment has made the climate scorching hot or deeply frozen.

FEATURE:
An intensely radioactive source, masking something more interesting.

RESOURCES:
Poor, some low-level finds.

SURVIVORS:
A scattered handful.

SOCIETY:
Barbarism, although loyalty in family groups.

PROBLEM:
A disease has laid waste to any life on this planet.

FEATURE:
Excavated skeletons of many giant beasts lie in the dust.

RESOURCES:
Average, there may be potential here.

SURVIVORS:
A scattered handful.

SOCIETY:
Tribal groups fight one another.

PROBLEM:
Indigenous predatory life stalks the world.

FEATURE:
An atmosphere processor on overdrive, churning out exotic gasses.

RESOURCES:
Average, there may be potential here.

SURVIVORS:
Small pockets of life. A few hundred souls at most.

SOCIETY:
A wary society but little conflict.

PROBLEM:
Severe volcanic or geological activity.

FEATURE:
Ghostly signals with no obvious origin.

RESOURCES:
Average, there may be potential here.

SURVIVORS:
A small population of [[2d6]] hundred.

SOCIETY:
A tenuous religious authority holds survivors together.

PROBLEM:
There is wreckage of a ship in orbit or on the ground.

FEATURE:
An 'ark' either in orbit or on the ground, containing samples of the life that was once on this world.

RESOURCES:
Good, this planet looks promising, with some easy pickings.

SURVIVORS:
A population of [[1d6]] thousand.

SOCIETY:
A warlord rules through strength and fear.

PROBLEM:
A Xenomorph variant is loose on this world.

FEATURE:
A smashed Engineer relic.

RESOURCES:
Good, this planet looks promising, with some easy pickings.

SURVIVORS:
A population of [[2d6]] thousand.

SOCIETY:
It's an orderly and peaceful community.

PROBLEM:
It's too late, the Perfected are already here and it's becoming a Proto-Hive.

FEATURE:
A signal from the ship of a junior member of the 3WE royal family.

RESOURCES:
Superb, this is a Garden of Eden for a prospector!

SCUFFS AND SCRAPES,
but no breach.

THERE IS DAMAGE BUT NO BREACH—YET.
Add +1 to the next roll on this table for that suit (this is cumulative).

BREACH,
but the tear has jammed closed again.  Lose one point of Air Supply immediately and every time an Air Supply roll is needed you lose two points of Air instead of one, for every rolled.

NASTY BREACH
Roll for Air Supply every round. 
 
The wearer gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

TERRIBLE BREACH
The suit is torn open and will lose one point of Air Supply per Round. 
 
The breach is so bad that there is a –1 modifier to the HEAVY MACHINERY roll to do a jury-rig repair. 
 
The wearer gains +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make a Panic Roll.

RUINED
The tear is so bad that the suit loses half its remaining Air Supply at the end of the Round in which it took this hit (round down) and the rest at the end of the next Round. 
  
There's a -2 modifier to the HEAVY MACHINERY roll to patch this up.
 
The wearer gains +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make a Panic Roll.
None—you're in this for the money.
You are curious about what happened out in the Far Spinward Colonies, but beyond that this is just a job to you.
The people of the colonies must be suffering.  The Great Mother Mission is vital in helping them recover.

Your ancestors settled in the Far Spinward Colonies before the Isolation—rolling on the COLONY SITUATION table on to see which one.  You need to find their descendants, or find out what happened to them, if you can.
You and a few close family or friends are looking for a fresh start.  They lie asleep aboard UNCSS Ìyánlá while you work to find that new future.
You're all-in for a new life and future.  Your entire family and many friends are in cryosleep on UNCSS Ìyánlá waiting for you to find them their new home.

ATMOSPHERE PROCESSOR:
It comes down with a bump but is otherwise undamaged.

COLONY MODULE:
It comes down with a bump but is otherwise undamaged.

ATMOSPHERE PROCESSOR:
It crash lands but is not seriously damaged. However, it will take three months to repair and bring online.

COLONY MODULE:
The module crash lands and suffers some damage, but no one is hurt. The colony loses 1 point from a random colony attribute.

ATMOSPHERE PROCESSOR:
It lands in the wrong place, blocking a river. The water pools around and inside the processor, creating a new lake.

COLONY MODULE:
The module's shielding breaks away. [[1d6]] colonists aboard are killed, but it's seen as a terrible accident.

ATMOSPHERE PROCESSOR:
A system fails and the processor loses control. It spins and crashes in a huge explosion leaving a twisted mass of wreckage. The incident is seen as an accident, but people blame the PCs.

COLONY MODULE:
The module suffers a catastrophic failure and is wrecked, killing [[2d6]] colonists aboard. The colony loses 1 point from two random attributes.
A random (non-expedition) colony has been explored.  The PCs hear the results.
Nothing much to report—all is in good order.

There has been unrest between different factions within the Great Mother Mission.  
Either: the 3WE has been struggling with NAPRO sympathizers.  
Or: members of the UA and UPP have scuffled, and one person has been hospitalized.  
Or: the UNISC has tried to mediate between the antagonistic factions but only made things worse.

There is news from home.  
Either: the UA-UPP Frontier War is escalating, and hostilities are spreading.  
Or: more worlds have seceded from the 3WE and joined NAPRO.

Either: An unknown disease has been sweeping through the UNCSS Ìyánlá's crew.  It doesn't seem serious, but she's been quarantined by the ICC for [[1d6]] weeks.  No re-supplies or major repairs are available until the ICC lifts the quarantine.  
Or: The UNCSS Ìyánlá has suffered damage from a local neutrino burst.  It's not serious but she must stop and undergo essential repairs for the next [[6d6]] days.
A maintenance failure on the UNCSS Ìyánlá and [[1d6*100]] sleeping colonists die.  You decide if any of these are connected with the PCs, or if there was foul play behind the malfunction.

EVENT:
Nothing Here.

EVENT:
A random PC kicks something under the water. If they check they see it's a dead body inside a compression suit that looks like it's been vacuum-packed, with all the air sucked from it.
They must make a Panic Roll.

EVENT:

[[2d6]] ampules (Heavy items) bob about in the water. They are all open and empty, except one which is sealed. Opening it requires the facilities of a medbay or laboratory, and a COMTECH roll. It contains three tiny cups, the contents of which start to swirl if touched. If this is touched or consumed it may have an effect on the PC. Roll [[1d6]]:

  • 1-3: Nothing happens, the sample is inert.
  • 4: The PC feels weird and gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.
  • 5: The PC suffers a convulsion as the sample makes changes to their body—the PC suffers an immediate critical injury as a result of the transformation, as the body part is permanently changed.  The effects of the injury are permanent and cannot be healed.
  • 6: The PC feels weird and gains +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make a Sickness Roll against Virulence 6 or be infected as a Stage I Abomination.

EVENT:
A prowling XX121LV Xenomorph is here. The PCs see a strange glowing light under the surface that suddenly winks out, followed by a sudden splash on the surface as something underneath moves quickly.
Enter stealth mode.

EVENT:
Strange shadows and noises—all PCs roll OBSERVATION, any who succeed are sure they saw something but can't pinpoint what.
They gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.

COLONY:
KOI-2650.01

Gorham Colony, a desolate and wind-swept mining colony, where only one outpost survives.

EXPEDITION OR CAMPAIGN EVENT:

name: PROSPECTING FINDS
description: Add +1 to the tens die for every success beyond the first.

results.description: It's a bust. There's nothing here.
Minor deposits of quality stone: marble, granite, limestone.
Minor deposits of iron, tin and other common ores.
Sandy silicon beds or salt flats.
Deep deposits of natural gas or oil.
Volcanic vents rich in sulphur and / or geothermal energy.
A supply of underground water, frozen springs or aquifers, clean and fresh.
Extensive fossil deposits of long-lost life.
A deep basin of clay deposits with gemstones and diamonds.
Meadows filled with new plant-life that has medical, industrial or agricultural possibilities OR deposits or vents rich in noble gases (argon, helium, radon, xenon, etc).
A huge underground vein of precious metals (gold, platinum, titanium, uranium, etc).
The gray stain on that rock is a microbial form of life you have never seen before.
Previously undetected and unknown form of complex alien life OR extensive fossil deposits of long-lost life.
Ruined remains of something you can't identify but it doesn't look natural... An archaeologist's dream find.
Partially buried remains of an old or ancient spaceship.

The PC feels strong for a moment, but it's a false hope. The black goo starts a rapid conversion of their DNA. Their bodies bubble and burst in a welter of black gore.

They die.

All who witness this gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.

The infection is slowed but not cured. The PC will feel better, but their doom is still assured.

However, the infection is dormant for four Shifts, but then continues to consume the PC as normal.

The infection is halted, and the PC will survive.

However, they have forever been tainted by the 26 Draconis strain—how will this affect them in the future?

IT'S A DUD:
The charge failed to build, and the attack is harmless.

MILD SHOCK:
The zapper fires only a mild electrical discharge. The target suffers an attack with [[8db]], Damage 1.

ELECTRIC BLAST:
The discharge causes a shock that blows the target off their feet and throws them back into the next zone—the target takes a [[6db]] attack, Damage 1, and gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

STUNNING SHOCK:
The target suffers a [[10db]] attack, Damage 1.
If any damage is done (ignore armor) they take just 1 point of damage but must make a STAMINA test.
If they fail they are stunned and cannot act until they succeed at a STAMINA test, made at the start of each Round. +1 STRESS LEVEL.

LIGHTNING BLAST:
The target suffers a huge shock attack with [[10db]], Damage 2.

KILLING CHARGE:
The target immediately suffers two critical injuries regardless of whether or not they are Broken.

HORRIFIC SCREECH:
The Deacon emits an ear-piercing wail that shakes anyone present to their very core. All victims within MEDIUM range must make an immediate Panic Roll.

RIPPING CLAWS:
By slashing hands and kicking feet, the Deacon’s claws tear at its victim. The attack is made using six Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 1 (armor piercing).

PIERCING SHRIEK:
The Deacon focuses on the nearest target and emits a terrible war-shriek directly at them. The victim must make an immediate STAMINA roll (no action) or lose their next slow and fast actions. They gain +1 STRESS LEVEL either way, as the Deacon marks them for death.

SLASHING LIMBS:
The Deacon uses its incredible agility to attack one victim with eight Base Dice [[8db]], Damage 1, then pivots and slashes at a second target within SHORT range. This second attack is made with six Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 1 (armor piercing). If there is no target within range the second attack is made against the original victim. All who witness this terrible display gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.

HOOK JAW:
The Deacon’s jaws spring forward, latching onto a victim’s limb. The victim is attacked using eight Base Dice [[8db]], Damage 2. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts critical injury #36 (even if the victim is not Broken) and grapples the victim. Anything the victim is holding is dropped and the Deacon stays latched on. Any CLOSE COMBAT attempt to break the grapple suffers a −3 modifier. The victim must make an immediate Panic Roll. As a slow action on each of its initiatives, the Deacon can then attack the grappled victim using six Base Dice [[6db]], Damage 2 (this attack cannot be blocked).

SNAP SHREDDER:
The Deacon makes its Hook Jaw attack with one alteration—once latched on to the victim’s limb, the Deacon immediately snaps its extended jaw back into its mouth. The victim is attacked using eight Base Dice [[8db]], Damage 2. If the attack causes damage, it automatically inflicts critical injury #54 or #55 (even if the victim is not Broken). The victim’s limb is shredded and severed in the process. This attack causes a Panic Roll.

name: Abomination Attacks (Stage III and IV)
description: Attack table for Stage III and IV Abominations

results.description: Horrible Roar: The Abomination screams in fury. All humans in Short Range must make an Immediate panic roll.
Fist Strike: The Abomination strikes its victim with a powerful punch. Roll for the attack with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1.

Throw: The abomination grabs the victim and tries to slam it into the nearest hard surface. Roll for the attack using [[9db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack hits, the victim lands prone at Short range from the Abomination, drops any hand-held Items, and must make an immediate Panic Roll.

Pounce: The Abomination leaps onto its victim like a big monkey. Roll for the attack using [[8db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the the attack hits, the victim is knocked to the ground, drops any hand-held Items, and must make immediate Panic Roll. The Abomination then starts pounding the victim with its powerful fists. This is resolved as an immediate bonus attack with [[12db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

Arm Pull: The Abomination grabs the victim's arm and tries to pull it clean off with its bare hands. Roll for the attack using [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes damage, it automatically triggers critical injury #54 (even if the victim is not Broken), triggering an immediate Panic Roll

Head Crush: The Abomination grabs the victim's head and tries to crush it with its bare hands. Roll for the attack using [[7db]] Base Dice, Damage 1. If the attack causes damage, it automatically triggers critical injury #64 (even if the victim is not Broken), killing the victim outright

Sonar Sweep: The Harvester takes in its surroundings by singing out a quick sonar pulse. Add one to the next roll on this table (for a maximum of 6). All PCs at up to LONG range are affected by the high-pitched squeal and get +1 STRESS LEVEL.

Sonar Pulse: The Harvester uses its sonar as a weapon. Everyone within SHORT range gets blasted by the ultra-sonic burst and must make a STAMINA roll (no action) or be stunned and lose their next action. Those who are not stunned must make a Panic Roll.

Charge: The cornered Harvester rushes the player who it deems to be the biggest threat. It makes a manic charge against them, and all those in that direction, as its charge crosses into the next zone. All targets must make a MOBILITY roll (no action) to get out of the way. Anyone who fails suffers an attack rolled with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 1, and is knocked prone.

Stampede: The Harvester goes berserk, like a bucking bronco, and flails around in a maddened frenzy. All targets within SHORT range suffer a crushing attack of [[6db]] Base Dice, Damage 2, and are knocked prone if hit.
Burrowing Claws: The beast’s claws are almost as bad as its maw, and it leaps on a poor victim. They suffer an attack with [[10db]] Base Dice, Damage 2.

Pulverize: The victim is dragged into the beast’s dreadful meat-grinder of a mouth. They get to make a last-ditch opposed CLOSE COMBAT roll against [[8db]] Base Dice (no action), to dodge that dreadful fate. If they fail the roll they die, their body mercilessly minced, their agonized screams ringing in the ears of their friends until the day they die. All who witness this receive +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make a Panic Roll.

name: Sub Table Critical Injuries on Xenomorphs
description: Sub Roll table for "3 Desperate Action" on Critical Injuries on Xenomorphs

results.description: Desperate Action: The Xenomorph is severely wounded and cries out in alien fury. It immediately gets to perform a fast and a slow action, outside of the normal turn order. It tries to escape (if it succeeds it regains half its Health).

Desperate Action: The Xenomorph is severely wounded and cries out in alien fury. It immediately gets to perform a fast and a slow action, outside of the normal turn order. It instantly attacks the closest opponent. If it fails to inflict any damage, the creature dies. If it succeeds, it regains one point of Health.
The frontier spells opportunity—the only way to get ahead in this world is to get a bigger share of the profits, and by hook or by crook you’re going to get it!
You only feel good when you hold power and influence over others and where better to do that than on the frontier. And using that power makes you feel even better.
The frontier is the cutting edge. Your future career and prospects were stagnant back home, and your chances can only be enhanced by taking a tour out here.
You have lost someone you love or care very deeply about, and they have traveled to the frontier to start again. You must follow them, find them, and at least learn why they ran away from you.
You belong to a select group, or you aspire to. Everything you do is focused on helping and gaining the good opinion and respect of that group.

Someone you cared about died, or an irreplaceable heirloom of enormous sentimental value was taken. The person responsible fled to the frontier to escape justice. You’re driven to find them and make them pay for their actions.
You’re a Company stooge, or if not you want to be. Getting to the frontier will get you that promotion or job in the Company, and once that’s done 	you’re set for life.
You are an explorer to your core—it’s in your blood. Your parents were explorers, and your grandparents before them. You survive by feeding your 	irresistible curiosity.
The prospect of stepping onto a virgin planet and making it into a home, not just for you but for everyone, keeps you awake at night with excitement.   Now it’s time to make it real.

The unexplored frontier shrouds knowledge just waiting to be uncovered. You must shine a light on these mysteries and reveal new scientific 	breakthroughs for the benefit of all (or your bank balance).
Your religion has been shaken and your god has not spoken to you in years. Perhaps you can find the inspiration you need on the frontier. Perhaps God is waiting for you there?
You heard all those stories and read all those (illegal) books. Now you want to find out for yourself if there’s any truth behind them. If there is, you can use that to your advantage.
You’ve been a loser as long as you can remember. Heading to the frontier and rebuilding a life for you and your family / friends will be the redeeming 	achievement of your life.
You never felt good enough and failure has always been your companion. And it hurts. You’ll show them! Before you’re done, you’ll have a planet named in your honor!
The prospect of making a new home on a planet millions of miles from your old life thrills you. You cannot wait to stand before your cabin on an icy lake and call it home.

Your old life has been swept away and everything you believed in or trusted has been proven false. You cannot be happy unless you leave and start again. So, leave you must.  The prospect of making a new home on a planet millions of miles from your old life thrills you. You cannot wait to stand before your cabin on an icy lake and call it home.

There has been a disaster in your life: a terrible bereavement, accident or other misfortune haunts you. People say it’s your fault, and whether they are right or wrong you cannot bear it. Escaping this torment by losing yourself on the frontier feels like the only option.
You always dreamed of the stars, and the untarnished spirit of exploration drives you forward.
